FuncDef:
The ospf timer wait command sets the wait timer on an OSPF interface.
The undo ospf timer wait command restores the default value.
By default, on broadcast interfaces, the wait interval is 40 seconds; on NBMA interfaces, it is 120 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the wait timer on an OSPF interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 235926000, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To change the wait timer, run the ospf timer wait command. If no Backup Seen event is received within the timer, the designated router (DR) election starts. Setting a proper value for the wait timer can slow down changes of the DR and the backup designated router (BDR) on the network, reducing network flapping. When setting the wait timer, note the following points:
The wait timer takes effect only on broadcast and NBMA interfaces.The value of the wait timer cannot be greater than the value of the dead timer.

Precautions
The command cannot be run on a null interface.
